document.ModsDocTitle: On the genera Qiongocera and Relictocera (Araneae, Psilodercidae) from Southeast Asia
document.docAuthor: Chang, Wan-Jin, Li, Fengyuan & Li, Shuqiang
document.docTitle: Relictocera wugen Li & Li, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: On the genera Qiongocera and Relictocera (Araneae, Psilodercidae) from Southeast Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the genera Qiongocera and Relictocera (Araneae, Psilodercidae) from Southeast Asia

subSubSection.paragraph: Relictocera wugen Li & Li sp. nov. Figs 2C, 3D, 6, 7, 12B, 13

Holotype: ♂ (IZCAS), Vietnam, Quang Binh Province, Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, outside of Botanical Garden, 17°32.895'N , 106°17.830'E , 261 m, 23.VIII.2015, Zhao Q., Li Y. & Chen Z. Paratypes: 1♂1♀ (IZCAS), same data as holotype.
The species name is a noun in apposition derived from the Chinese pinyin " wugen " ("five stripes") and refers to the five appendages on the male bulb, including the embolus.

Males of R. wugen sp. nov. can be distinguished from those of R. sigen sp. nov. by the nearly straight embolus (Fig. 7B) vs. a spiralled embolus Fig. 9B; R. wugen sp. nov. has 4 distinct and relatively long bulbal appendages (Fig. 7B) vs. 3 relatively short bulbal appendages (Fig. 9B); pyriform bulb (Fig. 7B) vs. globular bulb (Fig. 9B); carapace wider than long vs. longer than wide; females can be distinguished from R. qianzi sp n. by a pair of slender and elongated spermathecae that curve upward vs. ovoid spermathecae flanked laterally by a pair of translucent ducts (Fig. 6A).

caption.paragraph: Figure 6. Relictocera wugen sp. nov., male holotype and female paratype A internal genitalia, dorsal view B female epigastric area, ventral view C male habitus, retrolateral view D male habitus, dorsal view E female habitus, dorsal view F female habitus, ventral view. Abbreviations: GL = genitalic lobe, PR = clypeal protrusion, SP = spermatheca.

Figure 7. Relictocera wugen sp. nov., male holotype A palp, ventral view B palpal bulb, ventral view C palp, prolateral view D palp, retrolateral view. Abbreviations: AP = appendage of bulb, CP = cymbial protrusion, EM = embolus.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (Paratype). General features and coloration similar to those of male except for the absence of a quadrifurcate clypeal projection (Fig. 6E, F). Measurements: total length 2.50; carapace 0.75 long, 0.80 wide; abdomen 1.75 long, 0.80 wide. Leg measurements: I 6.54 (2.00, 0.16, 2.19, 1.19, 1.00), II 5.56 (1.56, 0.25, 1.50, 1.50, 0.75), III 3.90 (1.09, 0.16, 1.09, 1.09, 0.47), IV 6.25 (1.75, 0.25, 1.75, 1.75, 0.75). Epigastric furrow (slit) with pair of translucent lateral lobes (Fig. 6B). Internal genitalia: one pair of slender and elongated spermathecae curving anteriorly with pointed tips, bases separated by 3 times the width of the spacing of the of tips. (Fig. 6A).
Known only from the type locality (Fig. 13).
